content:
I believe that the composition area of the message should be improved to give Zulip a touch of beauty but above all better usability to encourage users to make the best use of it.
I thought to rely on most of the designs that I like of the Forums or other communication systems and I would see it as I "designed" it with Photoshop:

  1. Move tools between, message area and stream name.
  2. Add some emoji separated, the most used ones would be perfect or anyway those that indicate perhaps more serenity in the discussions, and next to the button to open them all.
  3. Move the cursor to enlarge the area, top right from the current position, because it is more logical.
    Then sincerely the Video Call icons should also be embellished, not very evident for the great use it could have .. users don't even notice it, added some easy formatting possibilities such as bold etc ...
    Thanks for your attention

I think it would be better to move the buttons to the right of the recipient selection.
I don't think I've mentioned this but I think if we could unify the PM and Stream compose boxes, so much could be improved...
I think we could also completely get rid of the Send button on Desktop.

logically putting them in the same current style and with the same current color, it would distract less

Gittenburg said:

or someone already suggested it somewhere because I can remember reading it

ah #3409

That feature existed back in 2013 but was removed in favor of the current arrangement, because of folks finding the way it worked confusing in usability studies. I personally would prefer to add the feature back in some way, but we do need to give it some thought.

Gittenburg said:

I think it would be better to move the buttons to the right of the recipient selection.

I think we could do that in wider windows; we'd need to be somewhat careful in narrower ones.

And we'd also need to think about usability; it's more intuitive for "Send" buttons to be at the bottom-right of a UI widget than the top-right. We definitely can't get rid of the "Send" button -- a huge fraction of users disable the "Enter sends" feature.
I don't like having the buttons sandwiched in there. Which leaves right of the recipient selection and the current position, but the former is hard. I really like moving the resizer though.
Hmm, how does one move the resizer? https://stackoverflow.com/questions/13126917/can-i-style-the-resize-grabber-of-textarea styles the element, but I'm not sure it can change the location.
